GSEAdv: Simulate

Lluís Revilla

August Pi i Sunyer Biomedical Research Institute (IDIBAPS); Liver Unit, Hospital Clinic
lrevilla@clinic.cat

14 September 2018

Source: vignettes/gsea_simulate.Rmd
gsea_simulate.Rmd

Abstract

Shows the methods and functions used to create new gene sets.

Introduction

This vignette assumes that the reader is familiar with the infraestructure build in Bioconductor around gene sets, mainly GSEABase. It provides examples of how to use the package to create and modify different gene sets.

Modifying existing gene sets

The first step towards simulate a GeneSetCollection is to modify it. There are two ways do modifying them: adding new relationships, or removing genes and GeneSets.

Modifying relationships

Adding new ones

We might want to add a gene to a gene set or to add a new gene set. We can do that with:

add(gss, gene = c("ha", "ZNF474", "CCDC100"), pathway = "new")
## GeneSetCollection
##   names: chr16q24, chr5q23, new (3 total)
##   unique identifiers: AFG3L1, ANKRD11, ..., ha (216 total)
##   types in collection:
##     geneIdType: NullIdentifier (1 total)
##     collectionType: NullCollection (1 total)
add(gss, gene = "ZNF474", pathway = c("chr16q24", "chr5q23"))
## GeneSetCollection
##   names: chr16q24, chr5q23 (2 total)
##   unique identifiers: AFG3L1, ANKRD11, ..., ZNF608 (215 total)
##   types in collection:
##     geneIdType: NullIdentifier (1 total)
##     collectionType: NullCollection (1 total)

Removing

Removing genes and GeneSets

Or we might want to remove a pathway or some genes:

# Remove a pathway
drop(gss, pathway = "chr5q23")
## GeneSetCollection
##   names: chr16q24 (1 total)
##   unique identifiers: AFG3L1, ANKRD11, ..., ZNF778 (129 total)
##   types in collection:
##     geneIdType: NullIdentifier (1 total)
##     collectionType: NullCollection (1 total)
drop(gss, pathway = 1) # 1 random pathway
## GeneSetCollection
##   names: chr5q23 (1 total)
##   unique identifiers: ACTBP4, ADAMTS2, ..., ZNF608 (86 total)
##   types in collection:
##     geneIdType: NullIdentifier (1 total)
##     collectionType: NullCollection (1 total)
drop(gss, pathway = c("chr5q23", "chr16q24")) 
## GeneSetCollection
##   names:  (0 total)
##   unique identifiers:  (0 total)
##   types in collection:
##     geneIdType:  (0 total)
##     collectionType:  (0 total)
# Remove some genes
drop(gss, gene = c("AFG3L1", "ANKRD11")) 
## GeneSetCollection
##   names: chr16q24, chr5q23 (2 total)
##   unique identifiers: APRT, BANP, ..., ZNF608 (213 total)
##   types in collection:
##     geneIdType: NullIdentifier (1 total)
##     collectionType: NullCollection (1 total)
drop(gss, gene = 5) # 5 random genes
## GeneSetCollection
##   names: chr16q24, chr5q23 (2 total)
##   unique identifiers: AFG3L1, ANKRD11, ..., ZNF608 (210 total)
##   types in collection:
##     geneIdType: NullIdentifier (1 total)
##     collectionType: NullCollection (1 total)
# Remove both, genes and pathways
drop(gss, pathway = "chr5q23", gene = c("AFG3L1", "ANKRD11"))
## GeneSetCollection
##   names: chr16q24 (1 total)
##   unique identifiers: APRT, BANP, ..., ZNF778 (127 total)
##   types in collection:
##     geneIdType: NullIdentifier (1 total)
##     collectionType: NullCollection (1 total)
drop(Info, pathway = "1430728", gene = c("10", "9"))
## Warning in check_size(object): Removing 1 genes sets with only one gene.
## GeneSetCollection
##   names: 194840 (1 total)
##   unique identifiers: 2, 3 (2 total)
##   types in collection:
##     geneIdType: NullIdentifier (1 total)
##     collectionType: NullCollection (1 total)

Dropping by number is aimed to make it possible to bootstrap with different GeneSetCollections comming from the same original one.

Simulating

All the functions to simulate new GeneSetCollections start with from*. As a summary of the methods available and what kind of data they use is provided below:

(#tab:table) The x indicates that it is a required argument of the functions. The parenthesis indicate that it is implicit.
method nGenes nPathways genesPerPathway pathwaysPerGene sizeGenes sizePathways
fromGPP (x) x
fromPPG (x) x
fromGPP_nGenes x (x) x
fromPPG_nPathways (x) x x
fromPPG_GPP (x) (x) x x
fromSizeGenes (x) (x) (x) (x) x
fromSizePathways (x) (x) (x) (x) x

When using more information to the simulations it takes more time (as it is randomly assigned). Also note that they must obey some simple rules: - a gene set cannot be of only one gene - a gene cannot be duplicated in a single gene set - there can’t be duplicated gene sets (gene sets with the same genes)

Side notes

Footnotes are displayed as side notes on the right margin1, which has the advantage that they appear close to the place where they are defined.
